name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Irvine - Spectrum

reviews.text: This hotel is very clean and well managed. There is a shuttle from John Wayne Airport several times a day. The front desk was cheerful and courteous. Restaurant staff were friendly and cordial. The food, especially breakfast, was very good, and they serve Starbucks coffee. I had a King room. Didn't spend much time there, but it was spotless. The hotel is just a few minutes away from Irvine Spectrum, walking distance actually, where there are many shops, and restaurants, and a Dave & Busters. Newport Beach, and Laguna beach, just a short drive. It's quiet at night. I recommend.
reviews.title: Excellent, well managed Doubletree

reviews.text: great hospitability, free stuttle service and is always available.
reviews.title: will be back for the cookies

reviews.text: Great breakfast. clean, neat and tidy.
reviews.title: Hmmm... This Double Tree is below standard

reviews.text: did not any issues during the stay. They have the best chocalate cookies in the worls.
reviews.title: Consistently Professional

reviews.text: Location is not that great. Not close enough to the Spectrum to be in the title. Parking fee is lame in the middle of a business center. We were surrounded by empty lots all weekend. Dinner was horrible. No wifi in the rooms. Room was clean and quite. Pool area was clean but busy day and night. My daughter left her cell phone in the room when checked out. We called back later in the day but got the run around. She never got her phone back. I don't think we'll be back.
reviews.title: Professional and friendly staff

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Nice long walk from Train Station

reviews.text: - convenient to Amtrak/Metrolink Station (5 min drive, 30 min walk)
reviews.title: Great place to stay on business - except for lack of wifi in rooms

reviews.text: - friendly staff
reviews.title: Nice enough place to stay.

reviews.text: - warm cookie and water upon arrival
reviews.title: Got good deal? go ahead....

reviews.text: - best lodging in Irvine Spectrum area
reviews.title: Always a sure thing.

reviews.text: We stayed one night for a local concert. Grounds, lobby and room were clean. Beds were comfortable. Location was perfect for events held at Verizon Ampitheater in Irvine. There was a shuttle available to the venue as well. I believe it was $5 per person, but am not certain.
reviews.title: Nice enough, but lacking wi-fi

reviews.text: I have 2 complaints. One is that there was a charge for parking. Really? $7 per day is just ridiculous when there was ample parking there. And no wi-fi available in the rooms? If I can get free wi-fi at McDonalds, I should be able to get it at a Doubletree. Come on, get with it!
reviews.title: Business Travelers - MUST READ (HHonors Secret)

reviews.text: This review will not repeat in detail any of the common reviews you will see on this hotel. So to get that out of the way, yes not having wireless interenet in the room is a pain. But I bring a long internet cord and I can work from the bed just fine.
reviews.title: No WiFi in the rooms?? What is this 1999?

reviews.text: Things you NEED to know:
reviews.title: Great Location & Friendly Staff

reviews.text: 1 - the shuttle service is what makes this hotel a deal. They pickup and drop off at the airport. They will even do door to door, even if it doesn't involve the hotel. For example, they pick me up at the airport and take me right to work, even before I check in.
reviews.title: Great Location, Nice Rooms - have to pay for parking?? Really??

reviews.text: It's time to start refreshing the rooms. Also, the breakfast buffet has been suffering lately (items not being replaced timely and quality going downhill). Staff is pleasant and rooms are fine for most business travelers, but the furnishings are wearing out. I've stayed here a ton, so I know my experience is not limited to just a couple of rooms or breakfasts.
reviews.title: Still the best business hotel in South Irvine, but ...

reviews.text: I was in town for the Spring Festival 6 hosted by Dodge/Chrysler/SoCalLx Club. Location is in a very convenient location to restaurants as well as many other attractions in the area. The shuttle made it even more convenient for those of us that arrived without a car or just didn't want to have to worry about parking at other locations. The drivers were extremely nice and courteous and were available to pickup within 15-20 minutes each and every time I called them. The rooms were adequately furnished, from the flatscreeen tv, to the bedding, and plenty of electrical outlets to plugin my laptop, phone etc. Too many times I have gone to hotels and there were not enough outlets without having to unplug lamps in the room. Restaurant was very good, and the staff was exremely courteous. I got up and ate breakfast every morning which is not something I normally do, it was that good. I would highly recommend this location and look forward to staying here again next year.
reviews.title: A+ service and attention to detail

reviews.text: Booked this hotel through Priceline and was definitely disappointed in the location. Oh well, that's what you get sometimes with Priceline. Hotel is in the middle of a business park area - it is not within walking distance to anything. Location is really for business only. True, it's less than 5 miles from the airport, but that is on the 405 freeway. At one point in my stay that drive took 25 minutes due to traffic.
reviews.title: $7 to Park!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Biggest problems other than location - they charge $7 per night for parking. This is absolutely not acceptable. Also, no wifi in the room - there is free wifi in the lobby, and if you have an ethernet chord, free internet in the room.
reviews.title: Liked the cookies

reviews.text: Booked this hotel through Hotwire - in the middle of a business park area - Irvine Spectrum Center nearby. In the area for a surprise birthday party in Lake Forest. Upon check in we received our two chocolate chip cookies - warmed up.
reviews.title: I tend to agree that the sound from hallway tends to come right in!

description: The DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Irvine Spectrum is set in the Irvine Spectrum Business Park, in the heart of Southern California's technological coast. This hotel in Irvine is 7 miles from John Wayne Orange County Airport and offers complimentary shuttle to and from the airport. Many things to do in Irvine, CA including Laguna Beach, Newport Beach and South Coast Plaza are minutes from the hotel.
